page.title: 19Population in Cornwood
page.content: Although the population has altered little over many years in actual numb- ers,it has changed in its make-up. In the churchyard,old family names are repetitious,remaining fairly constant until World War 2.From then on new names occur more rapidly.Now,few peo- ple marry within the parish,causing constant movement of pop. both into and out of the area.The motor-car has made Cornwood a dormer for Plymouth's labour force and also a pleasant coun- try residence for some naval families attached to Devonport,many of whom stay only a few years.Houses & cott- ages are constantly on the market; Dartmoor Park restrictions lending them certain advantages over the high- density estates of nearby Ivybridge. This flow of pop. and an increase in private transport has led to a break- down of community spirit in Cornwood.
